thread.title: Best WhatsApp Messages on Dal prices: 17 dialogues convey our feelings on rising pulse prices
thread.title_full: Best WhatsApp Messages on Dal prices: 17 dialogues convey our feelings on rising pulse prices

author: Rashmi Mishra
title: Best WhatsApp Messages on Dal prices: 17 dialogues convey our feelings on rising pulse prices
text:
Best WhatsApp Messages on Dal prices: 17 dialogues convey our feelings on rising pulse prices By Rashmi Mishra on October 25, 2015 at 2:32 PM Comments Brace yourself as tsunami of WhatsApp messages on rising dal prices are on their way. After onions, it is time for pulses to set our hearts racing with the steep rise in their prices. Narendra Modi government continue to find itself under scrutiny for the skyrocketing price of the basic edible items. While it is definitely no joke to buy pulses at over 150-200 rupees per kg, the big talking point has definitely become the butt of jokes on WhatsApp. Also See: Onion price rise leaves Bollywood celebs teary eyed! On one hand, there is hue and cry over the non-veg food items not being considered ideal, while on the other hand, you just cannot afford to buy the cardinal food item – Dal! We are sure that you must have come across several memes, forwards, jokes related to the rising dal prices on WhatsApp. So here is another set of WhatsApp message which has used the popular Bollywood movies dialogues to convey our feelings over this grave issue. You may not enjoy dal in your plate but reading these hilarious movies lines will certainly make your day. Whatsapp Message Reads: Kya aapke toothpaste mein dal hai. Mere ghar mein dal nahin, toothpaste mein kaise! Whatsapp Message Reads: Dalwale Dulhania Le Jayenge. Obviously. Whatsapp Message Reads: Kutte, kameene, main teri puri DAL pee jaoonga. Don’t angry garam Dharam. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Gabbar Singh - Arre O Saambha… kitne kilo DAL thi? Saambha - Poore 220 Rs/Kg, Sardar. Now that is some price you put to capture a wanted criminal. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: DAL ko khana mushkil hi nahi naamumkin hai. We could not have agreed more! 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Ek kilo DAL ki ki keemat tum kya jaano Modi babu. Well said Shanti. Whatsapp Message Reads: Gulabo Thodi DAL Khilado. After watching Shaandaar, we want dal as compensation for going through the torture. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Jaani jinke ghar dinner mein DAL hoti hai woh darwaza band karke khate hain! *SPEECHLESS*. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Ja Simran ja..kha le apni hisse ki DAL! A father cannot give a better gift than this. *TEARY-EYED*. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Mere Karan Arjun aayenge, ek kilo arhar DAL layenge. OMG, she was waiting for the dal. Hmmm. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Vijay: Aaj mere paas paisa hai, bangla hai, gaadi hai, naukar hai, bank balance hai, aur tumhare paas kya hai? Ravi: Mere paas DAL hai! Do we need to say anymore? 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Na talwaar ki dhaar se na goliyon ki bauchaar se. Banda darta hai to sirf DAL ki keemat hajar se. Poor Soul. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Pyar se DAL khila rahe hain, kha lo, rakh lo, varna thappad marke bhi khila sakte hain!! Hudd, Hudd Dabangg Dabangg Dabangg. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Sardar maine aapka DAL khaya hai. Ab Goli Khaa!! 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Tum log mujhe dhoond rahe ho aur main yahan DAL kha raha hun ..A**SMART MAN. 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Yeh DAL mujhe dede thakur . Just cannot stop remaining Sholay! 
Whatsapp Message Reads: Ye mazdoor ki DAL hai katiya. No messing, right. The government continues to ponder over the sudden upsurge in the dal prices; it’s the household that have to face the heat of being denied the most basic food item. From failing monsoons to the increase in the hoarders (black marketeers), there is abrupt deficiency in the ratio of demand and supply. The Centre has been making claims of doing everything best to stabilize the situation but looks like the dal scenario is here to stay, if not long but for a few months to say the least.
